availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward W. Graham (Green County, Kentucky, farmer, storekeeper, and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer, storekeeper, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Robert Graham and Elizabeth Young Graham. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attended school in Green County in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Storekeeper in Green County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from December 31, 1861, to February 10, 1862. Died on February 10, 1862.
